revised_title: Double Organs of Generation in Various Species: Lamprey, Conger Eel, Common Eel, Barnacle, and Earthworm
tldr: The author examines the reproductive organs and processes of various species, including the lamprey, conger eel, common eel, barnacle, and earthworm, and discovers that they all impregnate themselves, with some species exhibiting hermaphroditism.
